definition: abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: It summarizes the famous doctors experience, and promotes traditional Chinese medicine.
sentences.chinese: 总结名医经验，弘扬祖国医学。

sentences.english: Going among the masses to promote harmony requires carrying forward the spirit of earthquake relief work.
sentences.chinese: “深入群众促和谐”要弘扬汶川抗震救灾精神。

sentences.english: This trend reflects that the contemporary novels in China enlarge the spirit of human literature.
sentences.chinese: 这种倾向是当代小说弘扬“人的文学”精神的体现。

sentences.english: Only when the culture self-consciousness of Mongolian education promoted, could the grassland culture be promoted.
sentences.chinese: 弘扬草原文化是当代蒙古族教育义不容辞的责任。

sentences.english: Third, cultural cooperation should be reinforced to expand dialogue and carry forward traditional friendship.
sentences.chinese: 加强文化合作，扩大对话交流，弘扬传统友谊。

sentences.english: China will continue to carry forward its fine culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们将继续弘扬中华优秀文化。

sentences.english: It is the main community responsibility of the Chinese network media to carryforward national spirit at present.
sentences.chinese: 当前弘扬民族精神是中国网络媒体的主要社会责任。

sentences.english: The Qingping Cave has now been designated as an educational center of patriotism.
sentences.chinese: 如今，清平洞已成为弘扬爱国主义的教育基地。

sentences.english: Some Chinese moviemakers neglect values they should promote.
sentences.chinese: 中国一些拍电影的忽视了他们要弘扬的价值观。

sentences.english: House supervisors must obey China law and social moral.
sentences.chinese: 遵守中国法律法规，弘扬社会公德。

sentences.english: I don’t have any special aspiration to spread Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 我并没有特别的抱负，要去弘扬佛教。

sentences.english: The establishment of Social Security System for the Aged can also extend and carry forward the culture of filial piety.
sentences.chinese: 而养老保障制度的建立也可以延续和弘扬孝文化。

sentences.english: It is the highly commendable spirits deserving of the studying and emulation of all reformers.
sentences.chinese: 这是值得我们继承弘扬的可贵精神。

sentences.english: The other: a desire to celebrate the city's fashion heritage.
sentences.chinese: 另一个原因是，他想弘扬这个城市的时尚传统。

sentences.english: As a contemporary college students, is duty-bound to develop the national culture.
sentences.chinese: 作为当代大学生，弘扬民族文化更是义不容辞。

sentences.english: Continue to carry forward and cultivate the national spirit.
sentences.chinese: 坚持弘扬和培育民族精神。

definition: variant of 弘揚|弘扬[hong2 yang2]
to develop/to make full use of
to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another
to advocate/to initiate/to propose/to be a proponent of (an idea or school of thought)
to develop and promote/to carry forward/to bring to great height of development
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
Zhengxing district of Dandong city 丹東市|丹东市[Dan1 dong1 shi4], Liaoning
